text:
The Win32 binary download of 2.0.36 fails with the following message:
"This installation package could not be opened. Verify that the
package exists and that you can access it or contact the
application vendor to verify that this is a valid Windows Installer
package."

The "-ver" command on Windows gives:

Windows 98 [Version 4.10.2222]

msiexec.exe, without arguments, gives:

Windows Installer V 2.00.2600.2

The log file produced when msiexec is run with /L is:

=== Verbose logging started: 6/1/02  17:09:04  Build type: SHIP ANSI 
2.00.2600.02  Calling process: C:\WINDOWS\SYSTEM\MSIEXEC.EXE ===
MSI (c) (DB:3F): Resetting cached policy values
MSI (c) (DB:3F): Machine policy value 'Debug' is 0
MSI (c) (DB:3F): ******* RunEngine:
           ******* Product: apache_2.0.36-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi
           ******* Action: 
           ******* CommandLine: **********
MSI (c) (DB:3F): Note: 1: 2203 2: apache_2.0.36-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi 3: 
-2147287038 
MSI (c) (DB:3F): MainEngineThread is returning 2
=== Verbose logging stopped: 6/1/02  17:09:04 ===

Note that this installer worked fine with 1.3.
creator: rtrahan@monmouth.com
wrowe@apache.org
text:
This log isn't sufficient, try /L* instead of /L to provide an incredibly
  detailed report if you can reproduce the problem.  FWIW - we haven't seen
  similiar reports from any other Win9x users.

  Also check http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/binaries/win32/TROUBLESHOOTING.html
  for additional hints or tricks.  The popup (failure) should come with a number,
  that numeric error code is incredibly useful for searching the MSKB for similar
  issues.  Please provide the numeric error if available.

Need a verbose log to further track down the origin of this bug.
  Happy to review again if one is attached to this bug.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
